title: Digitization and Disintermediation in German Higher Education

author: Felix C. Seyfarth, University of St. Gallen

I am doing my PhD at a Business School in Switzerland and I'm a mook curator at a small liberal arts type school in northern Germany and my dissertation work concerns the landscape of digitalization strategies in the higher education sector in Germany.

Structures open up, opens up processes and institutions going forward in higher education.

Another domestic audience, most of all.

The political system in Germany, being federal strengthens the supervisory role of individual federal states.
What this means is, for example, a Copyright discussion now emerging.
If I, as a professor design MOOC, I shift to a different University.
Do I take it with me?
Is it mine or does it belong to my employer?
This question is not asked in Germany.
Because I didn't own the course to begin with, it was owned by the federal state who administers the University, who was merely providing the educational service.

They can do framework guidelines, but they have very little influence over the actual operations of education.
